title: Tripadvisor to cut 20% of staff amid internal restructuring
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Tripadvisor plans to cut 20% of its workforce, affecting approximately 600 employees, as part of an internal restructuring.
The restructuring involves merging Tripadvisor and Viator operations, integrating AI, and focusing on experience-driven growth.
The reorganization includes an $85 million cost-savings program, prompted by pressure from activist investor Starboard Value.

title: An abandoned tent has spurred a hiking mystery in New Hampshire
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: An abandoned tent was discovered in New Hampshire's White Mountains, prompting a search by Fish and Game officials.
No missing person reports were noted, but a found set of car keys did not match any nearby vehicles.
Social media posts about the mystery tent garnered attention, but authorities are still seeking the tent's owner.

title: Local obituary: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader who founded CharityTeams
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Susan Hurley, former Patriots cheerleader, passed away at 62, known for founding CharityTeams, raising $42 million for nonprofits.
Hurley, a North Reading native, trained Boston Marathon charity runners, creating events like 'Superhero 17' and 'Hop 21'.
She is survived by her two sons, fiancé Barry Foland, and a large extended family; celebration of life on Nov. 8.

title: Market Basket launches its own beer — here’s where to buy it
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Market Basket launched 'More For Your Dollar' lager, partnering with Vermont's Zero Gravity Beer.
The 12-pack lager is priced at $12.99, available in Massachusetts, Maine, and New Hampshire locations.
Market Basket's beer debut follows recent leadership changes, including Arthur T. Demoulas's ousting as CEO.

title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Over 900 defendants in Massachusetts remain without representation despite a modest pay raise for court-appointed attorneys.
Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court considers if judges can grant temporary pay raises to end the public defender work stoppage.
State legislature approved a 30% hourly pay increase for bar advocates, but issues with unrepresented defendants persist.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon visited Beacon Hill Books and Cafe in Boston, signing her debut novel 'Gone Before Goodbye'.
Witherspoon was in Boston for a Harvard Business School discussion and dined privately at the bookstore.
Her novel, co-authored with Harlan Coben, became an instant New York Times bestseller.

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: LaMar Cook, an aide to Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey, was arrested for trafficking cocaine to a state office building.
Republican lawmakers demand an investigation into Gov. Healey's vetting process following Cook's hiring despite his criminal history.
GOP gubernatorial candidates criticize Healey, calling for an independent probe into her administration's hiring practices.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Two teens were killed in a single-car crash on Route 140 South in New Bedford early Saturday.
The victims were Gabriel Siqueira, 17, of West Yarmouth, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15, of Dartmouth.
The driver, an 18-year-old from Dartmouth, sustained non-life-threatening injuries, and the crash investigation is ongoing.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police seek help identifying a man linked to downtown commercial burglaries since August 21.
Suspect reportedly used a pry tool to access businesses, stealing items like credit cards and electronics.
Similar break-ins reported by Boston University, Cambridge, and Northeastern University police through September 25.

title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tennessee Titans reportedly avoided trading with the New England Patriots at the NFL trade deadline.
Titans owner Amy Adams Strunk reportedly held ill will towards Patriots coach Mike Vrabel, her team's former coach.
Mike Vrabel coached Titans to NFL Coach of the Year but was fired after a 6-11 season in 2023.
